Class Computer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Computer

  • public class Computer
extends java.lang.Object
    Sets up computer's battleship locations and sets how to pick ships on their turn
    Version:
    05/24/2017
    Author:
    Phillip Sturtevant

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Computer()
      Constructs a Computer with 3 default ships.
      Computer(int quantityInput)
      Constructs a Computer with a given number of battleships

      • pickSetup

        public void pickSetup()
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Computer chooses which set-up of ships it will pick from the external file of ship locations.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws an error if program cannot find specified file

      • readShipLocations

        public void readShipLocations()

      • locationCheck

        public Location locationCheck(BattleshipWorld player,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Location> clickLocations)
        Computer randomly selects a cardinal direction away from first Battleship hit location.
        Parameters:
        player - the Computer's play area
        clickLocations - an array of the Computer's previous click locations
        Returns:
        the location of the next place the Computer will guess

      • patternLocCheck

        public Location patternLocCheck(BattleshipWorld player)
        Computer checks for second/third/etc. Battleship part on same Battleship target.
        Parameters:
        player - the Computer's play area
        Returns:
        the location of the next place the Computer will guess

        Returns:
        the location of the next place the Computer will guess

        Creates a random number within the given range starting from 0.

        Returns:
